items.title: WebSocket connection header case sensitivity #76
items.body: Not sure about adding a test for it.

items.title: Improved cleanup/closing of sockets
items.body: With the introduction of nonblocking sockets, some new cases need to be handled. Servers can now potentially be stopped and started again, so they have to properly close their sockets.

items.title: Close stream on `StreamError`
items.body: If there's a problem with the stream, there's no point in keeping it open.

items.title: Re-added error logging if a `StreamError` occurs
items.body: Error logging for `StreamError` is still required for debugging purposes (@LoganWright I wrongly omitted that in the previous PR).

items.title: Added common HeaderKey values
items.body:
Adds a set of common HeaderKey values as static variables. This will protect developers from mis-typing common header key values, and adds them to the auto-complete list in Xcode (or other IDEs).

Only header values that are considered "permanent" are included.

items.title: no need to close unopened fauxstream

items.body: It'd be nice to have access to this convenience

items.title: Add support for client-specified headers
items.body: These changes allow the WebSocket client to include client-specified headers.  This allows using VaporJWT for authorization of web socket clients

items.title: Allow the server to send an error (don’t always set the error length …
items.body:
…to zero)

Parse properly the reason string on the receiver of the error

items.title: Fixes URI parsing when bytes contains authority and existingHost is non nil.
items.body:
An issue surfaced when parsing the URI of a proxied HTTP request.

### Regular Query

```
> nc -l 4242

[...]

> curl http://localhost:4242/api/v2/

GET /api/v2/ HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:4242
User-Agent: curl/7.51.0
Accept: */*

```

### Proxied Query

```
> nc -l 4242

[...]

> http_proxy=http://localhost:4242 curl http://pokeapi.co/api/v2/

GET http://pokeapi.co/api/v2/ HTTP/1.1
Host: pokeapi.co
User-Agent: curl/7.51.0
Accept: */*
Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive
```

The presence of an `existingHost` isn't enough to determine if the buffer is free of an authority (as seen in the proxied query example above). This change prevents `parseAuthority` from bailing out if an `existingHost` is present by prioritizing the check on the buffer first.

In this instance, a decision has to be made whether the returned authority should come from `existingHost` or from the buffer. Currently the authority from the buffer will be returned. The added test case also asserts that the returned authority originates from the bytes array rather than the optional `existingHost` property.

items.title: configurable default server timeout
items.body: Right now we default 30, this is a quick change to make it configurable to end users.

items.title: configurable default server timeout
items.body: bringing change to 2.x as well

items.title: Support for SameSite cookies
items.body:
This PR adds support for [Same Site Cookies](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-first-party-cookies-07) which is a security feature to help mitigate CSRF and similar attacks. 

I'm also considering adding support for [Cookie Prefixes](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-httpbis-cookie-prefixes-00) if you think it will be useful? Would probably require a bit more logic to ensure that the cookies are valid if trying to set the prefixes, but nothing a few tests can't handle!

items.title: add big body test
items.body: Tests the fix for #119

items.title: Conformance is done at declaration site for HeaderKey.
items.body:
## Things done (Just improvements)
- [x] Conformance to protocol is done at the site/extension where it is declared. 
- [x] Moved equatable conformance to a static method rather than a global func.
- [x] Some minor indentation fixes.

items.title: Add percent encoding to url path with .urlPathAllowed characters
items.body:
When parsing an URI from a string, it's decoded and it's percent encoding is lost, causing some urls to fail (when using %20 to replace an space, for example).

I modified a line to add percent encoding to the path when it's being built.

In the strange case that `addingPercentEncoding` returns `nil`, the path is used without modification, like it was being used before this commit.

items.title: C parser
items.body:
- Moves Vapor/Engine to using NodeJS's C parser.
- 2.5x performance boost (`25138.64` to `65217.46` requests per second plaintext)
- Sockets can now re-use buffers

Some other plaintext benchmark results for comparison:
- Go/Gin: `59690.41`
- Swift/Kitura: `45132.76`
- JS/Express: `39930.29`
- Swift/Perfect: `28364.27`

items.title: add async server and responder type
simplify assert valid
items.body: This will allow for the HTTP client to proxy requests.

items.title: websocket stream
items.body: Moves websockets to accept a stream instead of a client, doing away with the `DuplexStreamRepresentable` protocol.
